alert.note: Alert for Klamath (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 4:53AM PDT until May 07 at 1:24AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Sprague River near Beatty affecting Klamath County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Sprague River...including Beatty...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sprague River near Beatty. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding of structures along the Sprague River in the vicinity of Sprague River, Lone Pine, and down stream can be expected. Widespread agricultural flooding is likely in this area as well. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 8.9 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.8 feet on 03/09/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM PDT.
